intro: Desmoscelis stachyoides, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its basal rosette of hairy, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its hairy foliage and compact growth habit make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
